The climate of Madrid in january is very bad

With very low temperatures, rarely exceeding 10° C, the cold weather dominates the weather in Madrid throughout January. Even though most of the time, the sun illuminates the sky, it is advisable to dress warmly in order to feel comfortable. In addition, relatively heavy precipitation occurs, as do intense showers.

Beginning of January in Madrid

During the first ten days, the mornings are not only fresh but are also foggy. If one wants to enjoy a bright sunny day - wait until the sun is high enough before scheduling any outings. In the evening, be attentive to the weather report because it is not uncommon to have rainy episodes at dusk.

Middle of January in Madrid

As at the beginning of the month, the weather conditions are not favorable - due to the cold and a few sporadic rains. It is therefore necessary to expect, from time to time, days with morning mists or with moderate showers that can even sometimes become intense.

End of January in Madrid

It is during the last ten days of the month that the climate throughout January in Madrid appears drier. Only, beware of relatively large cloud coverings. Moreover, there is a good chance that the clouds accumulated in the late evening will favor snowfall during the night.

January: another location in Spain?

If you want to go to Spain in january, there are destinations with better weather than Madrid:

In january, Malaga, Cartagena, Marbella, Torremolinos, Ayamonte and Barbate have good weather.

Finally, Alicante, Barcelona, Lloret de Mar, Sevilla, Valencia and A Coruña have a tolerable climate, but better than Madrid.

Weather data for Madrid in january:

Weather data for Madrid for january are derived from an average of the weather forecast since 2009 in Madrid. There is a margin of error and these forecasts are to be considered as general information only. The weather in Madrid can vary slightly from year to year, but this data should limit surprises.
